message.content:
cs.HC, cs.AI, cs.GR, cs.LG, cs.SI. 

The paper discusses the use of computer-based simulation training (CBST) and feedback intervention systems, which are relevant to several sub-categories in computer science. The focus on feedback and its presentation modalities suggests a strong connection to human-computer interaction (cs.HC). The use of technologies such as virtual and augmented reality in CBST suggests a connection to artificial intelligence (cs.AI) and graphics (cs.GR). The discussion of methods for feedback extraction and learning suggests a connection to machine learning (cs.LG) and social and information networks (cs.SI).
